context: The Estonian word 'viisakas' is an adjective that describes someone who is polite, well-mannered, and courteous. It can be used to describe both people's behavior (when declined as 'viisakalt') and their general character or disposition. The adjective has three forms: singular nominative masculine (viisakas), singular nominative feminine/neuter (viisaka), and plural nominative (viisakad).
